ygData.subject: Re: New Question
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry I didn t provide more details everyone, My skill was in the mid 80s, I tried to make skewers with the metal bits, and banded bracers, boots, and gorgets.
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry I didn't provide more details everyone,

My skill was in the mid 80s, I tried to make skewers with the metal bits, and
banded bracers, boots, and gorgets. So far I have attempted about 25 pieces of
banded armor and 20 skewers using components I did not build from scratch, and
my skill has never gone up while making them. Success rate is around 45%.

Does anyone know if EQ has any plans to give blacksmiths more items to make?
Seems to me you can get your skill up to adequate for anything a smith can make
by around level 18. What abou the next 32 levels of being a smith?

> From: "San Wong" <san@...>
>
> It was just bad luck but what were you trying to make and what is your skill
> level at?
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
> To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
> Date: Wednesday, June 16, 1999 10:15 PM
> Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] New Question
>
>
> >From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
> >
> >Hello everyone,
> >
> >I used some bits made by another smith to try to practice my
> >blacksmithing tonight and I failed on all 20 times to advance my
> >blacksmithing skill. Also, using store bought metal sheets making
> >banded armor, I failed every time to advance my skill.
> >
> >My question is:
> >
> >Do you have to make your own components in order for your
> >skill to advance or was this just bad luck?
> >
> >Thanks
> >David
> >
